page.title: 05CAPEL A VILLAGE MORNING
page.content: The first bus to Dover comes through at 6.33am. A few people get on the 7.31am to go to work. The 8.00am buses to Dover and Folkestone are very busy taking older children to Astor Secondary School, both Dover Grammar Schools, Folkestone School for Girls, The William Harvey Grammar School and Wingate School. The Primary School begins at 9.00am for children from Capel and the surrounding villages. In the Village Hall the underfives arrive at their playgroup. The postman, who drives a red car, usually has his radio playing loudly. There are two milkmen, from the Co_op and Northern Dairies. People stop and chat to their friends on their way to the shops or whilst they are walking their dogs. Then it is quiet again.
